text: Portsoy (Gaelic: Port Saoidh) is a burgh in Aberdeenshire, Scotland, formerly in the county of Banffshire. It is known for: *its local jewellery made from "Portsoy marble" (which is not marble, but rather serpentine) *its locally milled oatmeal which is sold around the world *its annual small boat festival. *its two historical harbours Category:Towns in Aberdeenshire
title: Portsoy
